7C612185B0504D2391B7C4BF646995BC.description: Review own work and set goals to improve it (e.g., check for missing words in writing).

047A649C639F46A9932DEFA981B8DAA8.description: Explain strategies used and why they were used.

27E72847ACC342979833AE63FD3DDC73.description: Use a range of strategies (e.g., unfamiliar word – rereads the sentence, uses picture cues, uses initial letter cues, breaks word into parts) when something does not make sense.

7FA4CA6A754E4D9FB5B3BA34942B3AAF.description: Reflect, with guidance, on own strategies (“What do I do well? How could I be better?”).

296D1F9348CF46F9899B356A114D95AD.description: Reflect, with guidance, on viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing by explaining what is effective or what they like in a text.

5669DF5EEE404C8B8F31DBA3148D52E2.description: Reflect on and assess their viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other representing experiences and strategies by participating in discussions and relating work to a set of criteria (e.g., “What did I learn?”).

E34F6DCD8AA14B2CA19ADE2E2AFB3864.description: Assess and Reflect (AR). Students will develop their abilities to assess and reflect on their own language skills, discuss the skills of effective viewers, listeners, readers, representers, speakers, and writers, and set goals for future improvement.

4B4B923AC8C54FE689428CE655DCF84B.description: Polish at least eight pieces through the year.

55FFCF2734884DFA993B418FE36E8DC7.description: Write a response with supporting details from a text viewed, listened to, or read.

F07CB48B651141B9A76A8040606F4A91.description: Write a friendly letter complete with date, salutation, body, closing, and signature.

1824664CC84247EF926BA9592B7F39AD.description: Write brief narratives based on own experiences and imaginations that move through a logical sequence of events and describe the setting, characters, character traits, goals, and events.

8A4C6497CBE64826B48948D82F94C734.description: Write short pieces in the form of reports that describe and explain familiar objects, events, and experiences.

3AF09F4FD69946219C3C62813CB914D6.description: Write stories, poems, songs, friendly letters, reports, and observations using techniques observed in reading texts (including First Nations and Métis resources).

5D9CCDC0A63F472E9F0CFFE7C2094F2C.description: Write groups of clear sentences that develop a central idea in a basic paragraph of six sentences.

7868D76EAE7A4225804670E13F3D2CA2.description: Understand and apply the appropriate cues and conventions (pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other) to construct and communicate meaning when writing.

1D1E705DEDB24D36BA33394892FA0AFF.description: Select and use task-relevant before, during, and after strategies when writing to communicate meaning.

2CF47D5E0E1644B3A509709C1E638289.description: Employ a writing process (e.g., planning, drafting, and “fixing up”).

7C30CCE9028D40F896528C78653B03D4.description: Write stories, poems, friendly letters, reports, and observations using appropriate and relevant details in clear and complete sentences and paragraphs of at least six sentences.

E3ADA73C43E744D981B87B6267E2A516.description: Explain how new ideas and information have added to understanding.

7CD7D6C283FD4CB0A7A31F3D77F1D470.description: Dramatize a scene from a folktale or traditional First Nations or Métis narrative.

1407BED2655441979C3F8B4A4AA43B5D.description: Make relevant contributions to class discussions and take turns.

4B1E8C6E49C44001B828D7A236B0E32A.description: Give directions to help or explain.

9A748A9BDFD244E68CDCDBC591690126.description: Deliver brief recitations (e.g., recite poems, rhymes, verses, and finger plays), participate in choral readings, and give oral presentations about familiar experiences or interests, organized around a coherent focus.

DF14F021934140ECA548B17969C4C1AE.description: Report on a topic with facts and details, drawing from several sources of information.

6B37119762DE4FBF8CB7DEA0D9B926A2.description: Recount experiences, stories (including contemporary and traditional First Nations and Métis stories), or current events, in a logical sequence and with necessary details.

8D705F81F5E0497298D8F4F1CA75073A.description: Understand and apply the appropriate cues and conventions (pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other) to construct and communicate meaning when speaking.

0229745254C644B6BD2BA117116C364D.description: Select and use task-relevant before, during, and after strategies when speaking to communicate meaning.

025829644C8E4324BFDBF510C740A54F.description: Use oral language to initiate and sustain a conversation with a number of exchanges, interact with others, exchange ideas on a topic, and engage in play.

CC7C42AE70F64EADABEF62C2F0C2D871.description: Speak clearly and audibly in an appropriate sequence for a familiar audience and a specific purpose when recounting stories and experiences, giving directions, offering an opinion and providing reasons, and explaining information and directions.

81079DF18255404DA0040FFE7234037D.description: Create dramatizations to express ideas and understanding.

9FC8C44567E54CBEABD827CE3BC3A1CD.description: Construct three-dimensional objects to clarify ideas and understanding.

99A05453172644C4A08F304598DEDA5B.description: Use sound or movement to demonstrate understanding.

661EB1BC37084233AB4D890FC4AB9B79.description: Combine illustrations and written text (e.g., captions, labels) to express ideas, feelings, and information.

D79DFEFE717E44A2A019B79EED9DBF63.description: Consider and choose appropriate text form (e.g., a play, a model, a diagram) to represent ideas and stories.

EA21483EC1C745E7B4825D4A197C66C3.description: Follow a model to communicate ideas and information about a topic.

83574F338F6848FCBCA337F153BF3C6E.description: Understand and apply the appropriate cues and conventions (pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other) to construct and communicate meaning when using other forms of representing.

1A27813F77644BA3827EE49FD45BFFD9.description: Select and use task-relevant before, during, and after strategies when using other forms of representing to communicate meaning.

0BD10B0C4FBB46F7945C1492C100DCE4.description: Design a visual representation (e.g., a picture, puppetry, a chart, a model, physical movement, a concrete graph, a pictographic, a demonstration, an advertisement for a toy) to demonstrate understanding.

41ED4494A3604B0E997BE232198FD610.description: Use a variety of ways to represent understanding and to communicate ideas, procedures, stories, and feelings in a clear manner with essential details.

0C3D16AD2B5540CD85C0F265BD2B8487.description: Use inquiry to explore a question or topic that is of individual or group interest including: considering personal knowledge and understanding of a topic to identify information needs, contributing relevant ideas and questions to assist in group understanding of a topic or task and to identify sources of additional information, accessing ideas using a variety of sources such as simple chapter books, multimedia and online resources, computers, and Elders, matching ideas and understandings to inquiry or research needs, categorizing related information and ideas using a variety of strategies such as linking significant details and sequencing ideas in a logical order, recording key ideas and facts in own words and identifying titles and creators of sources • examining gathered information, ideas, and understandings to decide what information to share or omit • sharing and presenting findings and conclusions,  asking questions (e.g., “What did I do that worked well?”) to reflect on inquiry and using the language of inquiry (e.g., “What do I want to find out? Where could I find information that would help me?”).

55DB29590B1943828FF584A4B4FC9B05.description: Tell, draw, write, and dramatize stories about self, family, community, and family/community traditions to express ideas and understanding.

826055454CAE4AB1A5EE119D2C78C5D4.description: Share own stories and creations with peers and respond to questions or comments.

26F5488A807F4864B51485DBAD176CAE.description: Use personal knowledge and experiences in communications.

4FC6AB1B2E6B4CFF90292A0E05040D29.description: Create spoken, written, and other representations that include: a specific message, several related ideas which are logically organized and developed, ideas and information which are clear and complete and appropriate use of language and conventions including conventional print.

DB927D7C581140B5BCD0F5BD4082FE8C.description: Use words, symbols, and other forms, including appropriate technology, to express understanding of topics, themes, and issues and make connections to own life

A17676A708054EBEBDB9AD0A233A9F61.description: Compose and create a range of visual, multimedia, oral, and written texts that explore: identity (e.g., My Family and Friends), community (e.g., Our Community) and social responsibility (e.g., TV Ads for Children) and make connections to own life

0C73201325CC485EBB7D6491F39A6C41.description: Compose and Create (CC). Students will develop their abilities to speak, write, and use other forms of representation to explore and present thoughts, feelings, and experiences in a variety of forms for a variety of purposes and audiences.

E7AED3C557A64A7DA066C0034862FAD4.description: Read familiar poem aloud with expression and attention to flow.

7F114BA4AC7F4F6F991478E11A1DE1A0.description: Read appropriate fiction and non-fiction texts at a reasonable rate (70-100 wcpm orally; 95-145 silently) with fluent pacing on practiced texts.

CEF87A7543D24711969907250CE38549.description: Read aloud with fluency, expression, and comprehension any familiar text that is appropriate for grade 2.

EBA346CDFA2D48A9996540854A6867AC.description: Read and retell the key ideas and elements (including main idea, supporting details, diagrams, headings, table of contents, glossary) of informational texts including First Nations and Métis resources.

7BEB1649C145481F9386D5674207A016.description: Read and retell (with support from the text) the key events and elements of a story (including setting, characters, character traits, problem and solution, and sequence of events).

99FB335025E84774B3B698B3E20D883D.description: Understand and apply the appropriate cues and conventions (pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other) to construct and confirm meaning when reading.

F3CC3512D7CD4ADBA3F6A9367520ED26.description: Select and use task-relevant before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when reading.

E9B121A9424840CBADC52B733CF433BB.description: Read and understand a variety of grade-level-appropriate narrative and informational texts including legends, traditional stories and folktales, poetry, environmental print, and predictable books including First Nations and Métis resources.

08218BA873644526906C5722A0F71FB0.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of gradeappropriate literary and informational texts read silently and orally by relating and retelling key events and ideas in sequence with specific details and discussing how, why, and what if questions.

33915C1C492741D68A918034EE2A79D2.description: Recall several ideas about a topic presented or discussed in class.

BF68EEE799094A158FAC230F099CFA18.description: Listen courteously during discussions and while working in pairs and small groups to share ideas, obtain information, solve problems, and ask and respond to relevant questions.

59EA877FE12E472FBD3D997C5D619CD3.description: Follow and retell the important steps in demonstrations.

307AC3B497A943359D3AD75004E1CF41.description: Ask for clarification and explanation of oral stories and information (including stories and information from contemporary and traditional First Nations and Métis resources).

ACF9EA47ADC5437B877DF9F5E7A93BF2.description: Paraphrase information that has been shared by others (e.g., a visitor such as a grandparent, an Elder, or a Knowledge Keeper).

F304013E50B34BE0B9968C644CE94093.description: Listen to and follow independently a series of related directions or instructions related to class activities.

5FC0890C5DF44CCF84588B9A81E6D0E5.description: Understand and apply the appropriate cues and conventions (pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other) to construct and confirm meaning when listening.

E10F2D1CF43747F992F096BCEEB90BAA.description: Select and use task-relevant before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when listening.

B3AAC07D7E544707B2E36372DCE1FBB8.description: Listen and demonstrate comprehension by retelling key points (who, what, where, when, and why) in grade-appropriate literary and informational texts including First Nations and Métis resources.

08B86B5E4A8C490AB7B9A0DA0F99C622.description: Listen and retell (with support from the text) the key literal and inferential ideas (messages) and important details heard in small- and large-group activities, and follow oral directions and demonstrations.

662F47A8F7EF4D1CADFE0C17FE55D485.description: Explain how elements such as colour, sound, music, physical movement, and arrangement enhance visual and multimedia texts and products including First Nations and Métis texts, visual art works, and performances such as music, dance, and drama.

CF1A1BDB59EB42AE862A58EDEB8046D3.description: Distinguish between a commercial and a program on television.

C4C04EE94FFF448690B61285B2BCD939.description: Identify the intent and appeal of particular television advertisements aimed at children.

AF6B91B191DF4FAB9D02D24E096A9A2B.description: View and interpret, with teacher support, the purpose of a message (e.g., to sell a product, to express feelings, to inform).

5CE26661F5C3414D916B3A9FAD55678B.description: Show courtesy and respect while viewing (e.g., presentations by individuals from various cultures including First Nations and Métis).

44DEBF5EF7C94A6EB41D3B4A71FFFFA0.description: Obtain information from different media (e.g., multimedia clips, websites, video clips, magazine photographs).

B5C3EA72219A40639ACE8147FE0BB25B.description: Understand and apply the appropriate cues and conventions (pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other) to construct and confirm meaning when viewing.

191F7E2B79724D0ABE3EC8F9CE9E2830.description: Select and use task-relevant before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when viewing.

227EF101057F444AB636D05B37AFF6FD.description: View and demonstrate comprehension of grade-appropriate visual and multimedia texts including multimedia clips, signs, illustrations, diagrams, photographs, graphs, simple charts, and posters.

4CECA9B7D7594F089D38B58FF884E4CD.description: View and explain (with support from the text) the key literal and inferential ideas (messages), important details, and how elements (such as colour, layout, medium, and special fonts) enhance meaning in grade-appropriate visual and multimedia texts.

2F7FB684D86441D2B17F9D21D2889421.description: Identify similarities and differences between what is known and what is presented in texts.

B7C8FF3B69394538870C9AA10CBFB240.description: Connect situations portrayed in texts (including First Nations and Métis texts) to personal experiences and prior learning.

4DB5D8D8D0F244319A84913FCA66EE40.description: Discuss the experiences and traditions of various communities and cultures portrayed in texts including First Nations and Métis resources.

50B130CF11164EBEA888205925283E8B.description: View, listen to, read, and respond to a variety of texts including First Nations and Métis resources that present different viewpoints and perspectives on issues and topics related to identity, community, and social responsibility and relate to own experiences.

A78D4BA565B14A179382A4797A62AF62.description: Comprehend and respond to a variety of grade-level texts (including contemporary and traditional visual, oral, written, and multimedia) that address: identity (e.g., Just Watch Me), community (e.g., People and Places) and social responsibility (e.g., Friendship) and make connections to prior learning and experiences.

F83F8D10D7124611B0E67C6B306A7D6F.description: Comprehend and Respond (CR). Students will develop their abilities to view, listen to, read, comprehend, and respond to a variety of contemporary and traditional grade-level-appropriate texts in a variety of forms (oral, print, and other media) from First Nations, Métis, and other cultures for a variety of purposes including for learning, interest, and enjoyment.
